Here are some basic notes:
This configuration works perfectly under 3.3 M1
This configuration does not work under 3.3 M2.

You can test this out yourself by using
http://silver.58k.com - hit the button to Login - 
First, the "Basic Authentication window will come up"
You can use username PRINTER1 password PRINTER1   (Its a test box)
I'll leave this up and running until 03/28.  This is running 3.3 M2.

The server.xml entry for AuthRealm is a reimplementation of JDBCRealm using
internal database pooling classes here at 58k.com.  It works perfectly on M1,
requires minor mods on M2.  On M2, the behavior that is seen is occuring
before this class is ever called. 

I've had to apply two changes to get the server to run at my site:
1) see bug 1056 for details about contexts with numbers
2) see bug 1057 for details about the jikes compiler for jsps

If you want to see how it should behave, you can test it on 
http://orange.58k.com  (Hit login, a form page should come up, and not
the "Basic Authentication Popup" of your average browser)

Please note that the "Basic Authentication Popup" only seems to happen
the first time your browser hits the login access.
